item.title: Interview Question: Explain CAP Theorem
item.description: 1. What is the CAP Theorem? The CAP Theorem states that a distributed system can only guarantee two out of three properties at the same time: Consistency (C): All users see the same data simultaneously. Availability (A): The system always responds to requests (even with stale data). Partition Tolerance (P): The system works even if parts of it lose communication. Key Insight: Network partitions (e.g., server crashes, dropped messages) are unavoidable.
